SEARCH
Package villagertalk.villagertalk

Klasse VillagerChatData

java.lang.Object
villagertalk.villagertalk.VillagerChatData
public final class VillagerChatData extends Object
VillagerChatData holds the data of a VillagerEntity and the chat history of the player and the villager. Also generates the system prompt that is displayed to the player when they start chatting with the villager, and contains various String formatting methods.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • VillagerChatData

      public VillagerChatData(net.minecraft.entity.passive.VillagerEntity villager, UUID playerID)
      Constructs a new VillagerChatData instance for the given villager and player.
      Parameter:
      villager - The VillagerEntity instance representing the villager.
      playerID - The UUID of the player interacting with the villager.

      Initializes various fields related to the villager and player interaction:

      • villager is set to the provided villager.
      • villagerID is set to the UUID of the villager.
      • playerID is set to the provided player ID.
      • profession is set to the villager's profession as a string.
      • biome is set to the villager's biome type as a string.

      If the villager does not have a custom name, a new name is generated using generateVillagerName() and set to the villager. The villager's name is stored in villagerName.

      The following fields are initialized with random values:

      • age is set to a random integer between 16 and 95.
      • attitude is set to a random value from the ATTITUDES array.
      • persuasiveness is set to a random integer between 1 and 10.

      Finally, the chatHistory is initialized with a new chat history using freshChatHistory().

  • Methodendetails

    • formatSystemPrompt

      private String formatSystemPrompt()
      Formats the system prompt string using the villager's attributes.

      This method uses SYSTEM_PROMPT_TEMPLATE to create a formatted string that includes the villager's name, age, profession, biome, attitude, persuasiveness, and trade offers.

      Gibt zurück:
      A formatted string that represents the system prompt, populated with the villager's current attributes and trade offers.

      The formatted string includes:

      • The villager's name (villagerName).
      • The villager's age (age).
      • The villager's profession (profession).
      • The villager's biome (biome).
      • The villager's attitude (attitude).
      • The villager's persuasiveness (persuasiveness).
      • The villager's trade offers, formatted as a string using formatTradeOffersIntoString(TradeOfferList).

    • formatTradeOffersIntoString

      private String formatTradeOffersIntoString(net.minecraft.village.TradeOfferList tradeOffers)
      Formats the trade offers into a string for display in the system prompt.

      This method takes a TradeOfferList of trade offers and formats them into a string that represents the trade offers in a readable format.

      Parameter:
      tradeOffers - The list of trade offers to format.
      Gibt zurück:
      A formatted string that represents the trade offers in the list.

      The formatted string includes:

      • A list of trade offers where the villager is selling items for emeralds.
      • A list of trade offers where the villager is buying items with emeralds.

    • generateVillagerName

      private String generateVillagerName()
      Generates a random name for the villager.

      This method generates a random name for the villager using a combination of beginning, middle, and ending syllables from the BEGINNING_SYLLABLES, MIDDLE_SYLLABLES, and ENDING_SYLLABLES arrays.

      Gibt zurück:
      A randomly generated name.

      Gibt zurück:

    • removeCommandsFromChatHistory

      private String removeCommandsFromChatHistory(String chat)
      Removes commands from the chat history string, by replacing them with an empty string. Uses the VillagerTalk.COMMANDS list of patterns to match and remove commands.
      Parameter:
      chat - The chat history string to process.
      Gibt zurück:
      The chat history string with commands removed.

    • freshChatHistory

      public List<com.theokanning.openai.completion.chat.ChatMessage> freshChatHistory()
      Clears and reinitializes the chat history with a refreshed system prompt.
      Gibt zurück:
      A list of chat messages representing the fresh chat history.

    • refreshSystemPrompt

      public void refreshSystemPrompt()
      Refreshes the system prompt with the current villager attributes.

      Parameter:
